data.title: Lady Verney
data.meta_description: The two strands of Mary Lady Verney’s life were at times conflicting and at times complementary, but still she sustained her career as a professional musician alongside her responsibilities as the
data.text:
The two strands of Mary Lady Verney’s life were at times conflicting and at times complementary, but still she sustained her career as a professional musician alongside her responsibilities as the mistress of Claydon House in Buckinghamshire.

Born Mary Vestey in 1925, she was educated at Downe House school, where her love of music was nurtured. After leaving in 1942, she spent several months in Oxford training as a pianist before serving in the Government Communications Service (GCS) in London.

After the war she continued her studies at the Royal Academy of Music under the pianist and composer Harold Craxton, but gave them up in 1948 — to Craxton’s annoyance and regret — in order to marry Ralph Verney, the eldest son of Sir Harry
